# Define storage type for each relevant service
storage_df = cost_df.withColumn('StorageType',
    F.when(is_storage_account, StorageType.StorageAccount.value)
    .when(is_managed_disk, StorageType.ManagedDisk.value)
    .when(is_managed_disk_redundancy, StorageType.ManagedDisk.value)
    .when(is_sql_db, StorageType.SQLDatabase.value)
    .when(is_sql_mi, StorageType.SQLManagedInstance.value)
    .when(is_netapp_files, StorageType.NetAppFiles.value)
    .when(is_backup, StorageType.Backup.value)
    .when(is_cosmos_db, StorageType.CosmosDB.value)
    .when(is_mysql, StorageType.MySQLDatabase.value)
    .when(is_postgres, StorageType.PostgreSQLDatabase.value)
    .when(is_eventhub, StorageType.EventHubs.value)
    .when(is_devops, StorageType.AzureDevOps.value)
    .when(is_azure_monitor, StorageType.AzureMonitor.value)
    .when(is_synapse, StorageType.SynapseAnalytics.value)
    .when(is_container_registry, StorageType.ContainerRegistry.value)
    .when(is_github, StorageType.GitHub.value)
    .when(is_insights_and_analytics, StorageType.InsightsAndAnalytics.value)
    .when(is_log_analytics, StorageType.LogAnalytics.value)
    .when(is_logic_apps, StorageType.LogicApps.value)
    .when(is_fabric, StorageType.Fabric.value)
    .when(is_snapshots, StorageType.Snapshots.value)
    .when(is_kusto_cluster, StorageType.KustoClusters.value)
    .when(is_aml_file_system, StorageType.AmlFileSystems.value)
    .otherwise(None)
)

storage_df = storage_df.where(F.col('StorageType').isNotNull())

# Aggregate quantities per day - used to derive the storage volume
storage_df = storage_df \
    .select('Date', 'StorageType', 'ResourceId', 'ResourceName', 'ResourceGroup', 'SubscriptionName', 'UnitOfMeasure', 'MeterName', 'AppID', 'Quantity') \
    .groupBy('Date', 'StorageType', 'ResourceId', 'ResourceName', 'ResourceGroup', 'SubscriptionName', 'UnitOfMeasure', 'MeterName', 'AppID') \
    .agg(F.sum('Quantity').alias('Quantity'))

# Lookup disk storage volumes from separate table
is_pre_allocated_disk = (F.col('StorageType') == StorageType.ManagedDisk.value) & (F.col('UnitOfMeasure') == '1/Month')
storage_df = storage_df.withColumn('DiskType',
    F.when(is_pre_allocated_disk, F.split(F.col('MeterName'), ' ').getItem(0)).otherwise(None)
)
storage_df = storage_df.join(disk_size_df.select('DiskType', 'DiskSizeGiB'), 'DiskType', 'left')

# Compute storage volume estimates from quantity
storage_df = storage_df.withColumn('EstimatedVolumeGiB',
    F.when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure') == '1 GiB/Hour', F.col('Quantity') / HOURS_PER_DAY)
    .when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure') == '1 GiB/Month', F.col('Quantity') * (HOURS_PER_MONTH / HOURS_PER_DAY))
    .when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure') == '1 GB/Month', F.col('Quantity') * (HOURS_PER_MONTH / HOURS_PER_DAY) * GIB_PER_GB)
    .when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure') == '1 TB/Month', F.col('Quantity') * (HOURS_PER_MONTH / HOURS_PER_DAY) * GIB_PER_GB * GB_PER_TB)
    .when(is_pre_allocated_disk, F.col('DiskSizeGiB'))
    .otherwise(None)
)
storage_df = storage_df.withColumn('EstimatedVolumeGiB', F.col('EstimatedVolumeGiB').cast(T.DoubleType()))

storage_df = storage_df.withColumn('EstimatedVolumeTiB', F.col('EstimatedVolumeGiB') / GIB_PER_TIB)
storage_df = storage_df.withColumn('EstimatedVolumePiB', F.col('EstimatedVolumeTiB') / TIB_PER_PIB)

    'PredictedCost6MonthLookback',
    'PredictedCost12MonthLookback',
    'PredictedCost24MonthLookback',
    'PredictedCostFullLookback'
]

prediction_column_mapping = {
    'PredictedCost6MonthLookback': Lookback.SixMonth.value,
    'PredictedCost12MonthLookback': Lookback.OneYear.value,
    'PredictedCost24MonthLookback': Lookback.TwoYear.value,
    'PredictedCostFullLookback': Lookback.Full.value

def compute_aggregated_forecasts(df, usage_option):
    schema = T.StructType([
        T.StructField("PeriodLabel", T.IntegerType(), False),
        T.StructField("ConsumptionForecast", T.DoubleType(), False),
        T.StructField("Lookback", T.StringType(), True)
    ])

    total_df = spark.createDataFrame([], schema)

    df = df \
        .select('Date', *prediction_columns) \
        .where((F.col('Date') >= '2025-05-01') & (F.col('Date') <= '2031-04-01'))

    df = df.withColumn('PeriodLabel',
        F.when((F.col('Date') >= '2025-05-01') & (F.col('Date') <= '2026-04-01'), '25/26')
        .when((F.col('Date') >= '2026-05-01') & (F.col('Date') <= '2027-04-01'), '26/27')
        .when((F.col('Date') >= '2027-05-01') & (F.col('Date') <= '2028-04-01'), '27/28')
        .when((F.col('Date') >= '2028-05-01') & (F.col('Date') <= '2029-04-01'), '28/29')
        .when((F.col('Date') >= '2029-05-01') & (F.col('Date') <= '2030-04-01'), '29/30')
        .when((F.col('Date') >= '2030-05-01') & (F.col('Date') <= '2031-04-01'), '30/31')
    )
    
    for column in prediction_columns:
        current_df = df.alias(f'{column}_df')
        current_df = current_df.select('PeriodLabel', column)
        current_df = current_df.withColumnRenamed(column, 'ConsumptionForecast')
        current_df = current_df.groupBy('PeriodLabel').agg(F.sum('ConsumptionForecast').alias('ConsumptionForecast'))
        current_df = current_df.withColumn('Lookback', F.lit(prediction_column_mapping[column]))

        total_df = total_df.union(current_df)

    total_df = total_df.withColumn('UsageOption', F.lit(usage_option))
    
    return total_df

agg_billing_df = compute_aggregated_forecasts(billing_df, usage_option=UsageOption.EQNRateWFX.value)
agg_adjusted_billing_df = compute_aggregated_forecasts(adjusted_billing_df, usage_option=UsageOption.EQNRateWOFX.value)
agg_retail_df = compute_aggregated_forecasts(retail_df, usage_option=UsageOption.Retail.value)

consumption_forecast_df = agg_billing_df.union(agg_adjusted_billing_df).union(agg_retail_df)

consumption_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.withColumn('Project',
    F.when(F.col('Lookback') == Lookback.SixMonth.value, F.lit('Organic Growth - Forecast based on last 6 months usage'))
    .when(F.col('Lookback') == Lookback.OneYear.value, F.lit('Organic Growth - Forecast based on last 1 years usage'))
    .when(F.col('Lookback') == Lookback.TwoYear.value, F.lit('Organic Growth - Forecast based on last 2 years usage'))
    .when(F.col('Lookback') == Lookback.Full.value, F.lit('Organic Growth - Forecast based on usage from entire history'))
)

consumption_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.withColumn('SubScenario', F.lit(SubsurfaceScenario.NotApplicable.value))
consumption_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.withColumn('SapScenario', F.lit(SAPScenario.NotApplicable.value))
consumption_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.withColumn('Key', F.concat(F.col('Project'), F.lit('-'), F.col('UsageOption'), F.lit('-'), F.col('SubScenario'), F.lit('-'), F.col('SapScenario')))

window = Window.partitionBy("Key").orderBy(F.asc("PeriodLabel"))

early_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.alias('early_forecast_df')
early_forecast_df = early_forecast_df.where(F.col('PeriodLabel') < '30/31')
early_forecast_df = early_forecast_df.withColumn('Kickoff', F.lit(KickoffOption.Early.value))
early_forecast_df = early_forecast_df.withColumn('PeriodIndex', F.row_number().over(window))

late_forecast_df = consumption_forecast_df.alias('late_forecast_df')
late_forecast_df = late_forecast_df.where(F.col('PeriodLabel') > '25/26')
late_forecast_df = late_forecast_df.withColumn('Kickoff', F.lit(KickoffOption.Late.value))
late_forecast_df = late_forecast_df.withColumn('PeriodIndex', F.row_number().over(window))

expanded_forecast_df = early_forecast_df.union(late_forecast_df)
## Combine organic and in-organic contributions into single dataframe

pivot = cost_df.groupBy('MeterCategory', 'SubscriptionName').pivot('ShortDate').agg(F.first('Cost'))
pivot = pivot.withColumn(start_date, F.when(F.col(start_date).isNull(), 0).otherwise(F.col(start_date)))
pivot = pivot.withColumn(end_date, F.when(F.col(end_date).isNull(), 0).otherwise(F.col(end_date)))
pivot = pivot.withColumn("IncreaseInPercentage", ((F.col(end_date) / F.col(start_date)) - 1) * 100)
pivot = pivot.withColumn("CostIncrease", F.col(end_date) - F.col(start_date))

pivot = pivot.withColumn('CostStatus', 
    F.when((F.col(start_date) == 0) & (F.col(end_date) == 0), 'Ignore')
    .when((F.col(start_date) == 0) & (F.col(end_date) > 0), 'New Service')
    .when((F.col(start_date) > 0) & (F.col(end_date) == 0), 'Removed Service')
    .otherwise('Continuous Service')

import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.window as W
import statsmodels.api as sm
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load usage source
cost_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/exports/monthly/ACMMonthlyActualCost/*/Extended_v3_ACMMonthlyActualCost_*.parquet'
cost_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(cost_path)

# Select appropriate columns
cost_df = cost_df.select('Date', 'CostInBillingCurrency', 'PayGPrice', 'Quantity')
cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Date', F.date_trunc('month', 'Date'))
cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('RetailCost', F.col('PayGPrice') * F.col('Quantity')).drop('Quantity', 'PayGPrice')
cost_df = cost_df.groupBy('Date').agg(F.sum('CostInBillingCurrency').alias('Cost'), F.sum('RetailCost').alias('RetailCost')).orderBy('Date')

# Filter away latest month - as we predict cost per month, it will mess up future predictions
cost_df = cost_df.filter(F.col('Date') < F.concat(F.date_format(F.current_date(), 'yyyy'), F.lit('-'), F.date_format(F.current_date(), 'MM'), F.lit('-'), F.lit('01')))

# Split dataframe into discounted and retail cost
discount_df = cost_df.alias('discount_df').drop('RetailCost')
retail_df = cost_df.alias('retail_df').drop('Cost').withColumnRenamed('RetailCost', 'Cost')

# Load billing source
billing_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/billing/BillingPeriods.parquet'
billing_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(billing_path)

# Compute invoiced amount
billing_df = billing_df \
    .withColumn('Cost', F.col('TotalUsage') - F.col('Adjustments') + F.col('AzureMarketplaceServiceCharges')) \
    .withColumn('Date', F.to_date(F.col('BillingPeriod'), 'yyyyMM'))\
    .select('Cost', 'Date') \
    .where(F.col('Date') < F.date_format(F.current_date(), 'yyyy-MM-01')) \
    .orderBy('Date')

# 9% cost increase April 2021
COST_INCREASE_2021 = 1.09
COST_INCREASE_DATE_2021 = '2021-04-01'

# 11% cost increase April 2023
COST_INCREASE_2023 = 1.11
COST_INCREASE_DATE_2023 = '2023-04-01'

# 12% cost increase February 2024
COST_INCREASE_2024 = 1.12
COST_INCREASE_DATE_2024 = '2024-02-01'

adjusted_billing_df = billing_df.withColumn('Cost',
    F.when((F.col('Date') >= COST_INCREASE_DATE_2021) & (F.col('Date') < COST_INCREASE_DATE_2023), F.col('Cost') / COST_INCREASE_2021)
    .when((F.col('Date') >= COST_INCREASE_DATE_2023) & (F.col('Date') < COST_INCREASE_DATE_2024), F.col('Cost') / (COST_INCREASE_2021 * COST_INCREASE_2023))
    .when(F.col('Date') >= COST_INCREASE_DATE_2024, F.col('Cost') / (COST_INCREASE_2021 * COST_INCREASE_2023 * COST_INCREASE_2024))
    .otherwise(F.col('Cost'))

def compute_ols_prediction(input_df, lookback, prediction_interval):
    input_df['x'] = range(len(input_df))

    # Estimate OLS model
    y = input_df['Cost'].values if lookback == -1 else input_df['Cost'].tail(lookback)
    x = input_df['x'].values if lookback == -1 else input_df['x'].tail(lookback)
    model = sm.OLS(y, sm.add_constant(x))
    result = model.fit()

    # Configure prediction period
    future_months = pd.date_range(start=input_df.index[-1], periods=prediction_interval, freq="MS")
    # future_months = future_months[1:]
    future_x = np.arange(input_df['x'][-1] + 1, input_df['x'][-1] + prediction_interval + 1)

    # Predict future cost
    x = sm.add_constant(future_x)
    predicted_cost = result.predict(x)

    # Create the predicted cost column label
    column_label = "FullLookback" if lookback == -1 else f'{lookback}MonthLookback'

    predicted_df = pd.DataFrame({"Date": future_months, f"PredictedCost{column_label}": predicted_cost})
    predicted_df = spark.createDataFrame(predicted_df)
    predicted_df = predicted_df.withColumn(f'PredictedCumulativeCost{column_label}',  F.sum(f"PredictedCost{column_label}").over(window) + input_df['CumulativeCost'][-1])
    return predicted_df

def produce_ols_results(input_df, interval):
    # Compute cumulative cost and prepare for prediction
    input_df = input_df.withColumn("CumulativeCost", F.sum("Cost").over(window))
    pdf = input_df.toPandas()
    pdf.set_index("Date", inplace=True)
    
    # Predict cost based on different lookback periods
    four_month_lookback_df = compute_ols_prediction(pdf, lookback=6, prediction_interval=90)
    eight_month_lookback_df = compute_ols_prediction(pdf, lookback=12, prediction_interval=90)
    twelve_month_lookback_df = compute_ols_prediction(pdf, lookback=24, prediction_interval=90)
    sixteen_month_lookback_df = compute_ols_prediction(pdf, lookback=-1, prediction_interval=90)

    # Combine prediction results into a single dataframe
    input_df = input_df.join(four_month_lookback_df, on='Date', how='outer')
    input_df = input_df.join(eight_month_lookback_df, on='Date', how='outer')
    input_df = input_df.join(twelve_month_lookback_df, on='Date', how='outer')
    input_df = input_df.join(sixteen_month_lookback_df, on='Date', how='outer')
    input_df = input_df.withColumn('Date', F.to_date('Date'))

    return input_df

billing_df = produce_ols_results(billing_df, interval=90)
adjusted_billing_df = produce_ols_results(adjusted_billing_df, interval=90)
discount_df = produce_ols_results(discount_df, interval=90)
retail_df = produce_ols_results(retail_df, interval=90)

## Finding SQL Server related cost

SQL cost are grouped into three categories:

1. SQL Virtual Machine - Cost with _MeterCategory_ like **Virtual Machines Licenses** and _MeterSubCategory_ like **SQL Server%** (besides SQL Server Express)
2. SQL Managed Instance - Cost with _ResourceId_ like **Microsoft.Sql/managedInstances**
3. SQL Database - Cost with _ResourceId_ like **Microsoft.Sql/servers**


### SQL Database

This category will include _MeterCategories_ like SQL Managed Instance, Microsoft Defender for Cloud, SQL Database and Azure Synapse Analytics.

Should exclude _Microsoft Defender for Cloud_ and _Azure Synapse Analytics_ as these meter categories is not applicable for HUB

### SQL Managed Instance

This category will include _MeterCategories_ like SQL Managed Instance and Microsoft Defender for Cloud.

Should exclude _Microsoft Defender for Cloud_ as this meter category is not applicable for HUB


## SQL Cost with VCPU

There is a lot of cost associated with SQL that has VCPUs set to 0. 
If the unit of measure for these cost items is inspected, it varies between _x hours_, _x / day_ and _x GB/month_
We would only be interested in cost with unit of measure equal to _x hours_ (corresponds to SQL serverless pools), whereas the other corresponds to memory/DTU cost.

## VM Related Cost

#### Comparing the two following queries

1. _ResourceId_ includes **/virtualMachines/** or **/virtualMachineScaleSets/** (dataset1)
2. _MeterCategory_ is **Virtual Machines** or **Virtual Machines Licenses** (dataset2)

Note: both queries also checks that _MeterSubCategory_ includes **Windows** or _ServiceInfo2_ is **Windows Server BYOL** to only account for Windows VMs

Based on the queries above, the resulting counts for november 2023 where:

1. 135,453 cost items
2. 136,203 cost items

There is a small difference between these two subsets.

Analysis of certain dataset columns yielded the following results:

**MeterSubCategory** column in dataset2 includes the following values that are not present in dataset1
- Av2 Series Windows
- Ev3/ESv3 Series Windows

**ProductName** column in dataset2 includes the following values that are not present in dataset1
- Virtual Machines Ev3/ESv3 Series Windows - E4 v3/E4s v3 - EU North
- Virtual Machines Av2 Series Windows - A1 v2 - NO East
- Virtual Machines F/FS Series Windows - F8/F8s - EU North

**MeterName** column in dataset2 includes the following values that are not present in dataset1
- A1 v2

**ai_ServiceType** column in dataset2 includes the following values that are not present in dataset1
- Standard_A1_v2
- Standard_F8
- Standard_E4_v3

After further inspection of the above dataset differences, all related costs to the odd values for columns in dataset2, they have the following facts in common:

- Very small subset of cost
- All are PAYG cost (no HUB enabled)
- The resource id of all these costs have the form: /subscriptions/df89af9f-9074-40b4-a620-1d35c0eea0a4/resourceGroups/rg-observability-dev/providers/Microsoft.Batch/batchAccounts/baobservabilitydev/pools/poolobservabilitydev
- All costs are associated with Microsoft.Batch consumed service type

This is why it is not covered by the dataset that requires virtualMachines or virtualMachineScaleSets to be part of the resource identifier

def load_old_pricesheet(year, month):
    # Read old pricesheet
    pricesheet_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/pricesheet/pricesheet-{year}{month:02d}.parquet'
    pricesheet_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(pricesheet_path)
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.where(F.col('offerId') == PROD_OFFER_ID)
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.select(*old_pricesheet_cols)

    # Convert old schema to new schema
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df \
        .withColumnRenamed('meterId', 'MeterID') \
        .withColumnRenamed('meterName', 'MeterName') \
        .withColumnRenamed('unitOfMeasure', 'UnitOfMeasure') \
        .withColumnRenamed('partNumber', 'PartNumber') \
        .withColumnRenamed('unitPrice', 'UnitPrice') \
        .withColumnRenamed('currencyCode', 'CurrencyCode') \
        .withColumnRenamed('includedQuantity', 'IncludedQuantity') \
        .withColumnRenamed('offerId', 'OfferID')

    # Prefix pricesheet columns with p to distinguish pricesheet columns when combined with usage file
    pricesheet_df = add_prefix_to_cols(pricesheet_df, 'p')
    return pricesheet_df

def load_new_pricesheet(date_range):
    # Load new pricesheet
    new_pricesheet_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/pricesheet/portal-export/FinOps-Pricesheet-Monthly/{date_range}/*/*.csv'
    pricesheet_df = spark.read.csv(new_pricesheet_path, header=True, inferSchema=True)
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.where(F.col('OfferID') == PROD_OFFER_ID)
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.select(*new_pricesheet_cols)

    # Prefix pricesheet columns with p to distinguish pricesheet columns when combined with usage file
    pricesheet_df = add_prefix_to_cols(pricesheet_df, 'p')
    return pricesheet_df

def merge_cost_and_price(cost_df, price_df):
    # Rename pricesheet columns to be prefixed with temp
    price_df = add_prefix_to_cols(price_df, 'temp')

    # Join temporary part number column on usage file part number 
    cost_df = cost_df.join(price_df, (cost_df.PartNumber == price_df.temp_p_PartNumber), how='left')

    # At this point the joined table will contain duplicate pricesheet column (p_ and temp_p_)
    for col in new_pricesheet_cols:
        p_col = f"p_{col}"
        temp_col = f"temp_{p_col}"

        # Merge individual pricesheet columns
        cost_df = cost_df.withColumn(p_col, F.coalesce(cost_df[p_col], cost_df[temp_col]))

        # Drop the temp column after merge (only left with p_ column)
        cost_df = cost_df.drop(temp_col)
    return cost_df

## Amortized Cost

### Savings Plan

Looking up cost with **PriceModel** set to _SavingsPlan_ yield two kinds of cost:
- Has **ChargeType** set to _Usage_ where EffectivePrice < UnitPrice
- Has **ChargeType** set to _UnusedSavingsPlan_ (MeterCategory = Unassigned) where EffectiveCost is 100 and CostInBillingCurrency is 0 (is this corresponding to the unused parts of the savingsplan?)

### Reservation

Looking at **IsRIUsage** set to _RI Usage_

There are two distinct charge types -> **Usage** and **UnusedReservation**

## Actual Cost

### Savings Plan

Looking up cost with **PriceModel** set to _SavingsPlan_ yield two kinds of cost:
- Has **ChargeType** set to _Usage_ where EffectivePrice and CostInBillingCurrency are 0
- Has **ChargeType** set to _Purchase_ (MeterCategory = Unassigned) where CostInBillingCurrency = EffectivePrice = UnitPrice is 73000 which corresponds to 100 NOK/Hour for roughly 30 days

### Reservation

Looking at **IsRIUsage** set to _RI Usage_

There are three distinct charge types -> **Usage**, **Purchase** and **Refund**
- ChargeType=Purchase --> EffectivePrice=UnitPrice and UnitPrice*Quantity = CostInBillingCurrency -> add up to get total cost for RI purchase
- ChargeType=Refund --> Same as above, just negative (since its money back) 
- ChargeType=Usage --> cost is always 0 since its covered by RI purchases

    .when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure').contains("TB"), 1000) # Standard measure in usage file is GB --> convertion factor between TB and Gb is 1000
    .when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure').contains("PB"), 1000000) # Standard measure in usage file is GB --> convertion factor between PB and Gib is 1000000
    .otherwise(1)
)

## Find eligible SP cost and compute potential savings

- Virtual Machines cost have unit of measure on format `x Hours` in pricesheet --> must divide UnitPrice by `x`
- Azure Function cost have unit of measure on format `x TiB Hours` or `x Hours` --> must divide UnitPrice by `x` then if GiB --> leave cost as-is, if TiB --> divide UnitPrice by 1024
- Azure App Service have unit of measure on format `x Hours` in pricesheet --> must divide UnitPrice by `x`
- Azure Container Instance cost have unit of measure on format `x TB Hours` or `x Hours` --> must divide UnitPrice by `x` then if GB --> leave cost as-is, if TB --> divide UnitPrice by 1000
- Azure Container Apps cost have unit of measure on format `x PiB Hours` or `x Seconds` --> must divide UnitPrice by `x` then if GiB --> leave cost as-is, if PiB --> divide UnitPrice by 1 048 576

from datetime import datetime
import calendar
import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.types as T
import warnings
from enum import Enum

class AHBStatus(Enum):
    Enabled = "Enabled"
    NotEnabled = "Not Enabled"
    NotSupported = "Not Supported"

class SavingsPlanStatus(Enum):
    Enabled = "Enabled"
    NotEnabled = "Not Enabled"
    NotBeneficial = "Not Beneficial"
    NotSupported = "Not Supported"

def get_last_day_prev_month(to_date):
    current_month = int(to_date[4:6])
    current_year = int(to_date[:4])

    previous_month = (current_month - 1) if current_month > 1 else 12
    previous_year = current_year if current_month > 1 else (current_year - 1)

    # Calculating the last day of the month
    last_day = calendar.monthrange(previous_year, previous_month)[1]

    # Creating a string date for last month
    return f"{previous_year}-{str(previous_month).zfill(2)}-{str(last_day).zfill(2)}"

def cost_extend_additional_info(cost_df):
    # Extend AdditionalInfo Column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AdditionalInfo', F.from_json('AdditionalInfo', 'map<string,string>', options={'inferSchema': 'true'}))

    # Creating an ID column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('id', F.monotonically_increasing_id())

    # Creating a list of columns we want to keep
    cols_to_keep = ["UsageType", 
                    "ImageType",
                    "ServiceType",
                    "VMName",
                    "VMApplicationName",
                    "VMProperties",
                    "VCPUs",
                    "AHB",
                    "vCores",
                    "RINormalizationRatio",
                    "ConsumedQuantity",
                    "DatabaseName"]

    for col in cols_to_keep:
        cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ai_' + col, F.coalesce(F.col(f'AdditionalInfo.{col}'), F.lit(None)))
    return cost_df

def preprocess_pricesheet(pricesheet_df):
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.where(F.col('OfferID') == PROD_OFFER_ID)
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.withColumn('NormalizedUnit', F.regexp_extract('UnitOfMeasure', r'^(\d+)', 1).cast('integer'))
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.withColumn('NormalizedUnitPrice', F.col('UnitPrice') / F.col('NormalizedUnit'))
    return pricesheet_df

def compute_sp_columns(cost_df, pricesheet_df):
    # Determine if cost is eligible to SP
    sp_enabled = (F.col('PricingModel') == 'SavingsPlan') & (F.col('ChargeType') == 'Usage')
    is_ondemand = (F.col('PricingModel') == 'OnDemand') & (F.col('ChargeType') == 'Usage')
    is_vm_compute = (F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Virtual Machines') & ~(F.col('MeterSubCategory').contains('Av1'))
    is_aas_compute = (F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Azure App Service') & (F.col('MeterSubCategory').isin(['Premium v3', 'Isolated v2']))
    is_af_compute = (F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Functions') & (F.col('MeterSubCategory') == 'Premium')
    is_aci_compute = (F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Container Instances')
    is_aca_compute = (F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Azure Container Apps')
    is_sp_eligible = is_vm_compute | is_aas_compute | is_af_compute | is_aci_compute | is_aca_compute

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('SPStatus', 
        F.when(sp_enabled, SavingsPlanStatus.Enabled.value)
        .when(is_ondemand & is_sp_eligible, SavingsPlanStatus.NotEnabled.value)
        .otherwise(SavingsPlanStatus.NotSupported.value)
    )

    # Only use prices for savingsplan for 3 year term
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.where((F.col('PriceType') == 'SavingsPlan') & (F.col('Term') == 'P3Y'))

    pricesheet_df =  pricesheet_df.withColumn('NormalizedMemoryFactor', 
        F.when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure').contains('TiB'), 1024) # Standard measure in usage file is GiB --> convertion factor between TiB and Gib is 1024
        .when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure').contains("PiB"), 1048576) # Standard measure in usage file is GiB --> convertion factor between PiB and Gib is 1048576
        .when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure').contains("TB"), 1000) # Standard measure in usage file is GB --> convertion factor between TB and Gb is 1000
        .when(F.col('UnitOfMeasure').contains("PB"), 1000000) # Standard measure in usage file is GB --> convertion factor between PB and Gib is 1000000
        .otherwise(1)
    )
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.withColumn('NormalizedP3YSPUnitPrice', F.col('NormalizedUnitPrice') / F.col('NormalizedMemoryFactor'))
    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.select('PartNumber', 'NormalizedP3YSPUnitPrice')

    cost_df = cost_df.join(pricesheet_df, 'PartNumber', 'left')

    # When cost is classified as eligible to SP, but does not av a P3Y Unit Price associated with it - it should not be eligible to SP
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('SPStatus', F.when((F.col('SPStatus') == SavingsPlanStatus.NotEnabled.value) & F.col('NormalizedP3YSPUnitPrice').isNull(), F.lit(SavingsPlanStatus.NotSupported.value)).otherwise(F.col('SPStatus')))

    # Some cost may have a more cost efficient unit price associated to it, than the corresponding 3PY SP unit price - these costs should avoid having SP associat with them
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('SPStatus', F.when((F.col('SPStatus') == SavingsPlanStatus.NotEnabled.value) & (F.col('NormalizedP3YSPUnitPrice') >= F.col('UnitPrice')), F.lit(SavingsPlanStatus.NotBeneficial.value)).otherwise(F.col('SPStatus')))

    return cost_df

def compute_AHB_columns(cost_df, pricesheet_df):
    ## DETERMINE IF WINDOWS/SQL SERVER IS HUB ENABLED/ELIGIBLE

    # Compute if Windows Server has Azure Hybrid Benefit enabled
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('WindowsAHB', 
        F.when(F.col('ResourceName').startswith('CVD-'), AHBStatus.NotSupported.value)
        .when(F.col('ServiceInfo2') == 'Windows Server BYOL', AHBStatus.Enabled.value)
        .when(F.col('MeterSubCategory').contains('Windows'), AHBStatus.NotEnabled.value)
        .otherwise(AHBStatus.NotSupported.value)
    )

    # Compute if SQL Server has Azure Hybrid Benefit enabled
    is_sql_db = (F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Sql/servers%')) & (F.col('MeterCategory').like('SQL%'))
    is_sql_mi = (F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Sql/managedInstances%')) & (F.col('MeterCategory').like('SQL%'))
    is_sql_vm = (F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Virtual Machines Licenses') & (F.col('MeterSubCategory').like('SQL Server%'))
    is_sql_arc = (F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.AzureArcData/sqlServerInstances%')) & (F.col('ai_AHB').isNotNull())
    is_sql_adf = (F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Azure Data Factory v2') & (F.col('MeterSubCategory').like('SSIS%'))

    is_sql_cost = is_sql_db | is_sql_mi | is_sql_vm | is_sql_arc | is_sql_adf

    NOT_SUPPORTED_AHB_SUBCATEGORIES = [
        'SQL Server Express Edition',
        'SQL Server Developer Edition',
        'SQL Server Web',
        'SingleDB/Elastic Pool Hyperscale - SQL License',
        'SQL Server Azure Disaster Recovery Benefit'
    ]

    NOT_SUPPORTED_PRODUCT_NAMES = [
        'Azure Arc-enabled SQL Server - Arc-enabled servers - Express edition',
        'Azure Arc-enabled SQL Server - Arc-enabled servers - Dev edition',
        'Azure Arc-enabled SQL Server - Arc-enabled servers - Web edition'
    ]

    is_not_supported = (F.col('MeterSubCategory').isin(NOT_SUPPORTED_AHB_SUBCATEGORIES)) | (F.col('ProductName').isin(NOT_SUPPORTED_PRODUCT_NAMES)) | (F.col('ResourceName').startswith('CVD-'))

    is_vm = F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines%')
    is_vm_ahb = is_vm & (F.col('MeterSubCategory') == 'SQL Server Azure Hybrid Benefit')

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('SQLAHB', 
        F.when(is_sql_cost & is_not_supported, AHBStatus.NotSupported.value)
        .when(is_sql_cost & is_vm_ahb, AHBStatus.Enabled.value)
        .when(is_sql_cost & is_vm, AHBStatus.NotEnabled.value)
        .when(is_sql_cost & (F.col('ai_AHB') == True), AHBStatus.Enabled.value)
        .when(is_sql_cost & (F.col('ai_AHB') == False), AHBStatus.NotEnabled.value)
        .when(is_sql_adf & F.col('MeterName').like('%AHB%'), AHBStatus.Enabled.value)
        .when(is_sql_adf & F.col('MeterName').like('%License Included%'), AHBStatus.NotEnabled.value)
        .otherwise(AHBStatus.NotSupported.value)
    )

    ## COMPUTE HUB NORMALIZED VCPUS FOR WINDOWS/SQL
    
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ai_VCPUs', F.col('ai_VCPUs').cast('int'))
    cost_df = cost_df.na.fill({'ai_VCPUs' : 0})

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ai_vCores', F.col('ai_vCores').cast('int'))
    cost_df = cost_df.na.fill({'ai_vCores' : 0})

    is_standard_sql_license = F.col('ProductName').like('%Standard%') | F.col('ProductName').like('%General%') | F.col('ProductName').like('%Std%')
    is_enterprise_sql_license = F.col('ProductName').like('%Enterprise%') | F.col('ProductName').like('%Critical%') | F.col('ProductName').like('%Ent%')

    # Compute the Windows AHB equivalent VCPUs
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('WindowsAHB_VCPUS', 
        F.when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') == 0, 0)
        .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') <= 8, 8)
        .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') <= 16, 16)
        .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') == 20, 24)
        .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') > 20, F.col('ai_VCPUs'))
        .otherwise(0)
    )

    # Extract vCore count for ADF SQL resource with this pattern
    adf_vcore_pattern = r'[A-Za-z](\d+)'
    adf_vcores = F.regexp_extract(F.col('MeterName'), adf_vcore_pattern, 1).cast(T.IntegerType())

    # Compute the SQL AHB equivalent VCPUs
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('SQLAHB_VCPUS', 
        F.when(is_sql_vm & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') == 0), 0)
        .when(is_sql_vm & is_standard_sql_license & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') <= 4), 4)
        .when(is_sql_vm & is_standard_sql_license & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') > 4), F.col('ai_VCPUs'))
        .when(is_sql_vm & is_enterprise_sql_license & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') <= 4), 16)
        .when(is_sql_vm & is_enterprise_sql_license & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') > 4), F.col('ai_VCPUs') * 4)
        .when((is_sql_mi | is_sql_db | is_sql_arc) & (F.col('ai_vCores') == 0), 0)
        .when((is_sql_mi | is_sql_db | is_sql_arc) & is_standard_sql_license, F.col('ai_vCores'))
        .when((is_sql_mi | is_sql_db | is_sql_arc) & is_enterprise_sql_license, F.col('ai_vCores') * 4)
        .when(is_sql_adf & is_standard_sql_license, adf_vcores)
        .when(is_sql_adf & is_enterprise_sql_license, adf_vcores * 4)
        .otherwise(0)
    )

    ## COMPUTE HUB PAYG LICENSE COST

    is_windows_hub_eligible = (F.col('WindowsAHB') != AHBStatus.NotSupported.value)
    is_sql_hub_eligible = (F.col('SQLAHB') != AHBStatus.NotSupported.value)

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('PricesheetJoinKey', 
        F.when(is_windows_hub_eligible,
            F.concat(
                F.lit('Windows Server'),
                F.when(F.col('MeterSubCategory') == 'Windows Server Burst', ' Burst - ').otherwise(' - '), 
                F.col('ai_VCPUs'), 
                F.lit(' vCPU VM License')
            )
        )
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_mi & is_standard_sql_license, 'SQL Managed Instance General Purpose - SQL License - vCore')
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_mi & is_enterprise_sql_license, 'SQL Managed Instance Business Critical - SQL License - vCore')
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_db & is_standard_sql_license, 'SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - SQL License - vCore')
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_db & is_enterprise_sql_license, 'SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool Business Critical - SQL License - vCore')
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_vm & is_standard_sql_license & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') < 5), 'SQL Server Standard - 1-4 vCPU VM License')
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_vm & is_enterprise_sql_license & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') < 5), 'SQL Server Enterprise - 1-4 vCPU VM License')
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_vm & is_standard_sql_license & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') >= 5), F.concat(F.lit('SQL Server Standard - '), F.col('ai_VCPUs'), F.lit(' vCPU VM License')))
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_vm & is_enterprise_sql_license & (F.col('ai_VCPUs') >= 5), F.concat(F.lit('SQL Server Enterprise - '), F.col('ai_VCPUs'), F.lit(' vCPU VM License')))
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_adf & is_standard_sql_license, F.concat(F.lit('SSIS '), F.split('MeterName', ' ').getItem(0), F.lit(' '), F.split('MeterName', ' ').getItem(1), F.lit(' - Standard')))
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_adf & is_enterprise_sql_license, F.concat(F.lit('SSIS '), F.split('MeterName', ' ').getItem(0), F.lit(' '), F.split('MeterName', ' ').getItem(1), F.lit(' - Enterprise')))
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_arc & is_standard_sql_license, 'Azure Arc-enabled SQL Server - Arc-enabled servers - Std edition - License only')
        .when(is_sql_hub_eligible & is_sql_arc & is_enterprise_sql_license, 'Azure Arc-enabled SQL Server - Arc-enabled servers - Ent edition - License only')
        .otherwise(None)
    )

    # Compute license priceses for ADF SSIS SQL compute
    adf_pricesheet = pricesheet_df.where(is_sql_adf)

    pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df \
        .select('Product', 'NormalizedUnitPrice') \
        .withColumnRenamed('Product', 'PricesheetJoinKey') \
        .withColumnRenamed('NormalizedUnitPrice', 'LicensePayGUnitPrice')

    # Only process if adf related rows exists -> if not the pivoting will fail
    if adf_pricesheet.count() > 0:
        adf_pricesheet = adf_pricesheet.withColumn('LicenseType', F.split('MeterSubCategory', ' ').getItem(1))
        adf_pricesheet = adf_pricesheet.withColumn('ComputeResource', F.concat(F.split('MeterName', ' ').getItem(0), F.lit(' '), F.split('MeterName', ' ').getItem(1)))
        adf_pricesheet = adf_pricesheet.withColumn('PricesheetJoinKey', F.concat(F.lit('SSIS '), F.col('ComputeResource'), F.lit(' - '), F.col('LicenseType')))

        # Each ADF pricesheet entry has an AHB and a PayG counter-part, use pivot to get the corresponding unit prices into a single pricesheet entry
        adf_pricesheet = adf_pricesheet.withColumn('AHB', F.when(F.col('MeterType').like('%AHB%'), 'AHBUnitPrice').otherwise('PayGUnitPrice'))
        adf_pricesheet = adf_pricesheet.groupBy('PricesheetJoinKey').pivot('AHB').agg(F.first('NormalizedUnitPrice'))
        adf_pricesheet = adf_pricesheet.withColumn('LicensePayGUnitPrice', F.col('PayGUnitPrice') - F.col('AHBUnitPrice'))
        adf_pricesheet = adf_pricesheet.select('PricesheetJoinKey', 'LicensePayGUnitPrice')

        # Add ADF SSIS License costs to pricesheet
        pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.union(adf_pricesheet)

    cost_df = cost_df.join(pricesheet_df, 'PricesheetJoinKey', 'left').drop('PricesheetJoinKey')

    # DB/MI Instances have a PayG Licence unit price per vCore - multiply by vCores to get PayG License cost for entire resource
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('LicensePayGUnitPrice', F.when(is_sql_db | is_sql_mi, F.col('LicensePayGUnitPrice') * F.col('ai_vCores')).otherwise(F.col('LicensePayGUnitPrice')))

    return cost_df

def cost_cast_column_types(cost_df):
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('UnitPrice', F.col('UnitPrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('PayGPrice', F.col('PayGPrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('Quantity', F.col('Quantity').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('EffectivePrice', F.col('EffectivePrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('CostInBillingCurrency', F.col('CostInBillingCurrency').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('Date', F.to_date(F.col('Date'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))\
                     .withColumn('BillingPeriodStartDate', F.to_date(F.col('BillingPeriodStartDate'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))\
                     .withColumn('BillingPeriodEndDate', F.to_date(F.col('BillingPeriodEndDate'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))

    return cost_df

def expand_cost_tags(cost_df):
    
    # Storing the Tags column in a new column, and cleaning it up to fit with CostAllocationType
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.regexp_extract(F.col('Tags'), '(?i)costallocationtype": "(.*)"', 0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.regexp_replace(F.col('CostAllocationType'), '(?i)costallocationtype": "', ""))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.split(F.col('CostAllocationType'),'"', 0).getItem(0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == "", None).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationTypeTag', F.col('CostAllocationType'))

    # Storing the Tags column in a new column, and cleaning it up to fit with CostAllocationCode
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.regexp_extract(F.col('Tags'), '(?i)costallocationcode": "(.*)"', 0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.regexp_replace(F.col('CostAllocationCode'), '(?i)costallocationcode": "', ""))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.split(F.col('CostAllocationCode'),'"', 0).getItem(0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationCode') == "", None).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCodeTag', F.col('CostAllocationCode'))
    
    print("Cost Tags expansion complete")

    return cost_df

def replace_empty_cost_fields_with_subscription_details(cost_df, application_df):
    print("Creating ActiveWBS column, copying over CostAllocationCode, replacing 'TOBESPECIFIED' and empty values then filling gaps with SubscriptionWBS...")

    # Apply Upper-case for all CostAllocationTypes and Codes
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.trim(F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationCode'))))

    # When the tag does not contain CostAllocationCode or CostAllocationType, then we fill/replace the value in ActiveWBSReason
    invalidCostAllocationMask = F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull() | F.col('CostAllocationType').isNull()
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(invalidCostAllocationMask, F.lit('CostAllocationType or CostAllocationCode not present in Tags')))

    # When either value in mask appears in AcitveWBS, add invalid reason in new column
    validCostAllocationType = ['WBS', 'APPID', 'CI']
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(~F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(validCostAllocationType), F.lit('Invalid CostAllocationType: not APPID, CI or WBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    # When the values in the columns below match the mask and the cost type is WBS, then:
    # regex pattern states that the string should start with a case insensitive letter, followed by a dot, followed by either letters, numbers or dots
    pattern = r'^[a-zA-Z]\.[a-zA-Z0-9.]+$'
    rmask = F.col('CostAllocationCode').rlike(pattern)
    cost_wbs = (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'WBS')

    # Applying valid WBS' as Active WBS'
    # 1. Where the CostAllocationCode follows the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, we apply the CostAllocationCode
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(cost_wbs & rmask, F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    # 2. Where the CostAllocationCode doesn't follow the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, we set the ActiveWBSReason to be "Invalid CostAllocationCode WBS"
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(cost_wbs & ~rmask, F.lit('Invalid CostAllocationCode WBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    # 3. Where the CostAllocationCode doesn't follow the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, the CostAllocationType is changed to "SubscriptionWBS"
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(cost_wbs & ~rmask, F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))

    # Applying valid AppIDs as Active WBS'
    # If the CostAllocationCode is empty, we fill/replace the column ActiveWBS with Operational WBS in the application_df
    map_app = application_df.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast(T.StringType())).select('AppID', 'OperationalWBS')
    joined_df = cost_df.join(map_app, (cost_df.CostAllocationType == 'APPID') & (cost_df.CostAllocationCode == map_app.AppID), how='left')
    cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('OperationalWBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('OperationalWBS')

    # Applying valid CIs as Active WBS'
    # Same here as above, but we merge the dataframes on ApplicationNames rather than AppID
    map_app = application_df.select('ApplicationName', 'OperationalWBS')
    # Apply join with case insensitivity
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName')))
    joined_df = cost_df.join(map_app, (cost_df.CostAllocationType == 'CI') & (cost_df.CostAllocationCode == map_app.ApplicationName_upper), how='left').drop('ApplicationName_upper')
    cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('OperationalWBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    
    # Alternative 1 remove "AppID" 
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('ApplicationName', 'OperationalWBS')

    # When ActiveWBS value is string 'TOBESPECIFIED', we replace the value with None. # Why this ActiveWBS have TOBSPECIFIED value? 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.upper(F.col('ActiveWBS')) == 'TOBESPECIFIED', F.lit(None)).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))

    # When Subscriptions are not attached to the costs (unassigned), we fill the values with Unassigned and state the ActiveWBSReason.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned Subscription, possibly unused RI/SP')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    # Now that we have filled in most places in ActiveWBS, if the rest of ActiveWBS is Null, then we apply the CostCenter WBS
    # When CostAllocationType is null, we fill it with the value from SubscriptionWBS
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID'), F.lit('AppID CostAllocationCode Invalid or Missing')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI'), F.lit('CI CostAllocationCode Invalid or Missing')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('CostCenter')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS'))) # Cost Center is identical to SubscriptionWBS. So we can remove subscription.json.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(~F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(validCostAllocationType), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType').isNull(), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType'))) #  Can be removed.

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBSReason').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'SubscriptionWBS'), F.lit('No valid AppID, WBS or CI')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    

    # When CostAllocationType is a specific string, we fill/replace the value in ActiveWBSReason 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI', F.lit('CI WBS Lookup from SNOW')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID', F.lit('AppID WBS Lookup from SNOW')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'WBS', F.lit('WBS Cost Tag used')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.upper(F.col('ActiveWBS')))

    # For cases that where CostAllocationCode is empty, we will use AppID from SerivceNow and Application from Subscription.json to replace.
    mask3 = (F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(['APPID']) & F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull())
    mask4 = (F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(['CI']) & F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull())
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.when(mask3, F.col('AppID')) \
                                                       .when(mask4, F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App')) \
                                                       .otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationCode'))).drop('AppID')

    return cost_df

def get_application_names(cost_df, application_df):

    # Masks for CI and AppID
    ci_mask = F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI'
    appid_mask = F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID'

    # When AppID is present, we use the application name from the Service-Now Application list
    # First convert AppID to a string, then select the desired columns
    map_app = application_df.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast(T.StringType())).select('AppID', 'ApplicationName')

    # Apply case insensitivity merge by creating upper case columns
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode_upper',F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName')))

    # Merge CostAllocationCode on APPID
    cost_df = cost_df.join(map_app, cost_df.CostAllocationCode_upper == map_app.AppID, how='left')

    # Make copy of service now app list for second merge
    map_app_copy = map_app.alias('map_app_copy').withColumnRenamed('AppID', 'NewAppID').withColumnRenamed('ApplicationName_upper', 'NewApplicationName_upper').withColumnRenamed('ApplicationName', 'NewApplicationName')

    # Merge CostAllicationCode on ApplicationName copy
    cost_df = cost_df.join(map_app_copy, cost_df.CostAllocationCode_upper == map_app_copy.NewApplicationName_upper, how='left')

    # Populate original AppId and ApplicationName columns from the copied columns
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AppID', F.when(F.col('AppID').isNull(), F.col('NewAppID')).otherwise(F.col('AppID')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ApplicationName', F.when(F.col('ApplicationName').isNull(), F.col('NewApplicationName')).otherwise(F.col('ApplicationName')))

    cost_df = cost_df.drop('CostAllocationCode_upper', 'ApplicationName_upper', 'NewAppID', 'NewApplicationName_upper', 'NewApplicationName')

    # Create Application_Name column based on Application from ServiceNow to start with.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.col('ApplicationName'))

    # Resolve CostAllocationCode and CostAllocationType typo by replacing Application_name with SubscriptionServiceNow-App value 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID') & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNull(),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))\
                                                    .when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI') & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNotNull(),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App')).otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when(((F.col('CostAllocationType') == "SubscriptionWBS") | (F.col('CostAllocationType') == "WBS"))&(F.col('Application_Name').isNull()),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))\
                                                     .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name_upper',F.upper(F.col('Application_Name')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ServiceNowApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ServiceNowAppID',F.col('AppID')).drop('AppID')

    # Lookup application in ServiceNow. Those applications that can be found will be merged.
    cost_df = cost_df.join(map_app,cost_df.Application_Name_upper==map_app.ServiceNowApplicationName_upper,how='left')

    # Fill empty AppID with AppID from ServiceNow
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AppID',F.when(F.col('AppID').isNull(),F.col('ServiceNowAppID'))\
                                          .otherwise(F.col('AppID'))) 

    # Remove unused Columns
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('Application_Name_upper','ApplicationName','ServiceNowAppID','ServiceNowApplicationName_upper','ApplicationName_upper')


    # Application Name will be "Unknown" when SubscriptionServiceNow-App is equal to Application_name as well as AppID is empty.
    # This indicates that application from subscription.json file can not be found in ServiceNow. One of Application example is DATAHUB - MARKETING AND SUPPLY, not found in ServiceNow.
    # cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name', F.when((F.upper(F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))==F.upper(F.col('Application_Name'))) & (F.col('AppID').isNull()),F.lit('Uknown'))\
    #                                                 .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))

    # If Subscription Application is empty or null - set application name to 'Unknown' and AppId to null
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name', 
        F.when((F.col('Application_Name').isNull()) | (F.col('Application_Name') == ''), F.lit('Unknown')).otherwise(F.col('Application_Name'))
    )

    # Setup dummy application reference for Danske Commodities related cost
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name', 
        F.when((F.upper(F.col('SubscriptionName')).contains('DANSKE')) & (F.col('Application_Name') == 'Unknown'), 'Danske Commodities')
        .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name'))
    )

    return cost_df

def add_azure_service_information(cost_df, service_df):
    # Remove duplicate rows by groupBy+count
    service_df = service_df.withColumn('service_ResourceType', F.lower('ResourceType'))
    service_df = service_df.groupBy('service_ResourceType','ServiceName','ServiceCategory', 'ServiceModel').count().drop('count')

    # Count number of distinct resourcetypes in dataset
    count_df = service_df.groupBy('service_ResourceType').count()

    # Separate services with unique resource types (unambiguous in terms of service type) - i.e where the count of resource types is 1
    unambig_df = count_df.filter(count_df['count'] == 1).join(service_df, 'service_ResourceType').drop('count')

    # Separate services with ambiguity in terms of service types - i.e where the count of resource types is greater than 0
    ambig_df = count_df.filter(count_df['count'] > 1).join(service_df, 'service_ResourceType').drop('count')

    # Add prefix to service datasets for joining purposes
    unambig_prefix = 'unambig_'
    for col in unambig_df.columns:
        unambig_df = unambig_df.withColumnRenamed(col, unambig_prefix + col)

    unambig_prefix = 'ambig_'
    for col in ambig_df.columns:
        ambig_df = ambig_df.withColumnRenamed(col, unambig_prefix + col)

    # Extract resource type from resource id
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('temp_resource_id', F.lower(F.col('ResourceId')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ResourceType', F.regexp_extract('temp_resource_id', '/providers/([^/]+/[^/]+)', 1)).drop('temp_resource_id')

    # Join cost resource types on unambiguous resource types
    cost_df = cost_df.join(unambig_df, cost_df.ResourceType == unambig_df.unambig_service_ResourceType, how='left').drop('unambig_service_ResourceType')

    # Join cost resource types and meter category on ambiguous resource types and service name
    cost_df = cost_df.join(ambig_df, (cost_df.ResourceType == ambig_df.ambig_service_ResourceType) & (cost_df.MeterCategory == ambig_df.ambig_ServiceName), how='left').drop('ambig_service_ResourceType')

    # Merge joined service columns and drop remaining columns from service datasets 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ServiceModel', F.when(F.col('unambig_ServiceModel').isNotNull(), F.col('unambig_ServiceModel')).otherwise(F.col('ambig_ServiceModel')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ServiceName', F.when(F.col('unambig_ServiceName').isNotNull(), F.col('unambig_ServiceName')).otherwise(F.col('ambig_ServiceName')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ServiceCategory', F.when(F.col('unambig_ServiceCategory').isNotNull(), F.col('unambig_ServiceCategory')).otherwise(F.col('ambig_ServiceCategory')))
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('ambig_ServiceModel', 'ambig_ServiceName', 'ambig_ServiceCategory', 'unambig_ServiceModel', 'unambig_ServiceName', 'unambig_ServiceCategory')

    # Join cost resource types and meter sub category on ambiguous resource types and service name
    cost_df = cost_df.join(ambig_df, (cost_df.ResourceType == ambig_df.ambig_service_ResourceType) & (cost_df.MeterSubCategory == ambig_df.ambig_ServiceName), how='left').drop('ambig_service_ResourceType')

    # Merge joined columns with previously merged service columns
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ServiceModel', F.when(F.col('ServiceModel').isNotNull(), F.col('ServiceModel')).otherwise(F.col('ambig_ServiceModel')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ServiceName', F.when(F.col('ServiceName').isNotNull(), F.col('ServiceName')).otherwise(F.col('ambig_ServiceName')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ServiceCategory', F.when(F.col('ServiceCategory').isNotNull(), F.col('ServiceCategory')).otherwise(F.col('ambig_ServiceCategory')))
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('ambig_ServiceModel', 'ambig_ServiceName', 'ambig_ServiceCategory')

    return cost_df

def transform_cost_data(cost_df):

    warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=FutureWarning)
    cost_df = cost_extend_additional_info(cost_df)
    cost_df = cost_cast_column_types(cost_df)
    cost_df = expand_cost_tags(cost_df)
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn("ResourceLocation", F.lower(F.trim(F.regexp_replace(F.col('ResourceLocation'), "\s+", ""))))
    
    return cost_df

def compute_hub_and_sp(cost_df, pricesheet_df):
    pricesheet_df = preprocess_pricesheet(pricesheet_df)
    cost_df = compute_sp_columns(cost_df, pricesheet_df)
    cost_df = compute_AHB_columns(cost_df, pricesheet_df)
    return cost_df

def validate_wbs(cost_df, wbs_df):
    wbs_df = wbs_df.select('WBS', 'IsActive')

    # Join WBS df on active WBS, to assess whether the assigned active WBS is closed or not
    cost_df = cost_df.join(wbs_df, cost_df.ActiveWBS == wbs_df.WBS, 'left').drop('WBS')

    # If active WBS is closed, it should be re-assigned to the subscriptn WBS
    is_closed_wbs = (F.col('IsActive') == F.lit(False)) & (F.col('CostAllocationType') != F.lit('SubscriptionWBS'))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(is_closed_wbs & (F.col('SubscriptionWBS').isNotNull()), F.col('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(is_closed_wbs, F.lit('Assigned WBS is closed.')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(is_closed_wbs, F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))

    # Remove redundant column
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('IsActive')
    return cost_df

def combine_subscriptions_and_applications(cost_df, subscription_df, application_df):
    
    cost_df = cost_df.join(subscription_df, cost_df.SubscriptionId == subscription_df.SubId, how='left')
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('SubId')

    cost_df = replace_empty_cost_fields_with_subscription_details(cost_df, application_df)
    print('WBS population complete. Populating application names')
    cost_df = get_application_names(cost_df, application_df)    
    print('App-name population complete')

    return cost_df

import pandas as pd

def pre_process_subscriptions(subscriptions_df):
    subscriptions_df = subscriptions_df.select('SubscriptionId', 'OperationalWBS', 'Application')
    subscriptions_df = subscriptions_df.withColumnRenamed('SubscriptionId', 'SubId')
    subscriptions_df = subscriptions_df.withColumnRenamed('OperationalWBS', 'SubscriptionWBS')
    subscriptions_df = subscriptions_df.withColumnRenamed('Application', 'SubscriptionServiceNow-App')
    return subscriptions_df

    print('start to write to container')
    cost_df.write.format('parquet').mode('overwrite').option('path', destinationFilename).save()
    print('File write complete!')

import requests
import datetime
import pyspark.sql.types as T
import pyspark.sql.functions as F

def generate_billing_periods(initial_year, initial_month):
    now = datetime.datetime.now()
    current_year = now.year
    current_month = now.month

    billing_periods = []

    # Loop through the years and months and add the dates to the list
    for year in range(initial_year, current_year + 1):
        start_month = 1 if year > initial_year else initial_month
        end_month = current_month if year == current_year else 12
        for month in range(start_month, end_month + 1):
            date_str = f"{year}{month:02}"
            billing_periods.append(date_str)

    return billing_periods

def fetch_billing_details(billing_account_id, billing_period, api_version, access_token):

    # Build Azure management API billing endpoint
    endpoint_url = BASE_URL
    endpoint_url += f"billingAccounts/{billing_account_id}/"
    endpoint_url += f"billingPeriods/{billing_period}/providers/Microsoft.Consumption/balances?"
    endpoint_url += f"api-version={api_version}"

    headers = {
        'Authorization': 'Bearer ' + access_token
    }

    response = requests.get(endpoint_url, headers=headers)
    result = response.json()
    return result

billing_periods = generate_billing_periods(2018, 5)

schema = T.StructType([
    T.StructField("Id", T.StringType(), True),
    T.StructField("BillingPeriod", T.StringType(), True),
    T.StructField("BillingAccountId", T.StringType(), True),
    T.StructField("Currency", T.StringType(), True),
    T.StructField("BeginningBalance", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("EndingBalance", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("NewPurchases", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("Adjustments", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("Utilized", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("ServiceOverage", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("ChargesBilledSeparately", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("TotalOverage", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("TotalUsage", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("AzureMarketplaceServiceCharges", T.DoubleType(), True),
    T.StructField("BillingFrequency", T.StringType(), True),
    T.StructField("PriceHidden", T.BooleanType(), True)
])
df = spark.createDataFrame([], schema)

for billing_period in billing_periods:
    print(f'Fetching billing period {billing_period}')

    data = fetch_billing_details(BILLING_ACCOUNT_ID, billing_period, '2019-10-01', access_token)

    new_row = [(
        data['id'],
        billing_period,
        BILLING_ACCOUNT_ID,
        data['properties']['currency'],
        data['properties']['beginningBalance'],
        data['properties']['endingBalance'],
        data['properties']['newPurchases'],
        data['properties']['adjustments'],
        data['properties']['utilized'],
        data['properties']['serviceOverage'],
        data['properties']['chargesBilledSeparately'],
        data['properties']['totalOverage'],
        data['properties']['totalUsage'],
        data['properties']['azureMarketplaceServiceCharges'],
        data['properties']['billingFrequency'],
        data['properties']['priceHidden']
    )]
    new_df = spark.createDataFrame(new_row, schema)

    df = df.union(new_df)

import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.types as T
import pyspark.sql.window as W
import statsmodels.api as sm
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from dateutil.relativedelta import relativedelta
import time

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=FutureWarning)
## Default L1 to TDI if deparment cannot be resolved
## Keep Top 10 expensive meter categories, and bin remainder as a new category called "other"

category_window = Window.partitionBy("MeterCategory")
cost_df = cost_df.withColumn("MCTotalCost", F.sum("Cost").over(category_window))

rank_window = Window.orderBy(F.col("MCTotalCost").desc())
cost_df = cost_df.withColumn("Rank", F.dense_rank().over(rank_window))

cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('MeterCategory',
    F.when(F.col('Rank') > 10, 'Other')
    .otherwise(F.col('MeterCategory'))
)

cost_df = cost_df.drop('MCTotalCost', 'Rank')

# Need to aggregate on meter category and business area as dim(application_name) >> dim(business_area)
cost_df = cost_df \
    .groupBy('Date', 'MeterCategory', 'OrgUnitLevel0') \
    .agg(F.sum('Cost').alias('Cost')) \
    .orderBy('Date')
## Predict cost per meter category and

# Integers represent number of months
PREDICTION_END_DATE = '2025-02-01'
LOOKBACK_PERIOD = 12

today = datetime.today().replace(day=1, hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)

prediction_end_date = datetime.strptime(PREDICTION_END_DATE, '%Y-%m-%d')
prediction_interval = (prediction_end_date.year - today.year) * 12 + (prediction_end_date.month - today.month)

lookback_date = (today - timedelta(days=LOOKBACK_PERIOD*30)).replace(day=1)
lookback_date_formatted = lookback_date.strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
lookback_diff = (today.year - lookback_date.year) * 12 + (today.month - lookback_date.month)

# Filter away latest month - as we predict cost per month, it will mess up future predictions
cost_df = cost_df.filter(F.col('Date') < today)

# Create a Meter Category + OrgUnitLevel0 identifier - as we will build one regression model for each identifier
cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ModelIdentifier', F.concat(F.col('MeterCategory'), F.lit('.'), F.col('OrgUnitLevel0')))

# Create schema for resulting df
schema = T.StructType([
    T.StructField("Date", T.DateType(), True),
    T.StructField("MeterCategory", T.StringType(), True),
    T.StructField("OrgUnitLevel0", T.StringType(), True),
    T.StructField("Cost", T.DoubleType(), True)
])

result_df = spark.createDataFrame([], schema)

for model_identifier in distinct_model_identifiers:
    print(f'Processing {model_identifier} cost')
    start_time = time.time()
    temp_df = cost_df.where(F.col('ModelIdentifier') == model_identifier).orderBy(F.asc('Date')).select('Date', 'Cost')

    # Convert pyspark df to pandas for OLS model
    temp_pdf = temp_df.toPandas()
    temp_pdf.set_index("Date", inplace=True)

    temp_pdf['x'] = range(len(temp_pdf))

    # Estimate OLS model
    if LOOKBACK_PERIOD > len(temp_pdf['Cost']):
        y = temp_pdf['Cost'].values
        x = temp_pdf['x'].values
    else:
        y = temp_pdf['Cost'].tail(LOOKBACK_PERIOD)
        x = temp_pdf['x'].tail(LOOKBACK_PERIOD)
        
    model = sm.OLS(y, sm.add_constant(x))
    result = model.fit()

    # Configure prediction period
    future_months = pd.date_range(start=temp_pdf.index[-1], periods=prediction_interval, freq="MS")[1:]
    future_x = np.arange(temp_pdf['x'][-1] + 1, temp_pdf['x'][-1] + prediction_interval)

    # Predict future cost
    x = sm.add_constant(future_x)
    predicted_cost = result.predict(x)

    predicted_df = pd.DataFrame({"Date": future_months, "Cost": predicted_cost})

    split_model_identifier = model_identifier.split('.')
    meter_category = split_model_identifier[0]
    business_area = split_model_identifier[1]

    predicted_df = spark.createDataFrame(predicted_df).withColumn('MeterCategory', F.lit(meter_category))
    predicted_df = predicted_df.withColumn('OrgUnitLevel0', F.lit(business_area))
    predicted_df = predicted_df.select('Date', 'MeterCategory', 'OrgUnitLevel0', 'Cost')

    result_df = result_df.union(predicted_df)
    end_time = time.time()
    print(f'Successfully processed {meter_category}.{business_area} cost in {round(end_time - start_time, 2)} seconds.')

import pandas as pd

def load_and_process_solum_subscriptions(subscription_path):

    subscription_df = spark.read.json(subscription_path)
    subscription_df = subscription_df.withColumnRenamed('id', 'SubId')
    subscription_df = subscription_df.withColumn('id', F.monotonically_increasing_id())

    try:
        subscription_df = subscription_df.withColumn('tags', F.from_json(F.col('tags')))
    except:
        print('Already a json file')

    # Expanding the tags list into separate columns
    subscription_df = subscription_df.withColumn('SubscriptionWBS', F.col('tags.WBS'))
    subscription_df = subscription_df.withColumn('SubscriptionServiceNow-App', F.col('tags.ServiceNow-App'))
    subscription_df = subscription_df.drop('tags')

    # Dropping unnecessary columns and setting the schema
    columns_to_keep = ['SubId', 'SubscriptionWBS', 'SubscriptionServiceNow-App']
    subscription_df = subscription_df.select(columns_to_keep)

    return subscription_df

def load_and_process_servicenow_subscriptions(subscription_path):
    subscription_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(subscription_path)
    subscription_df = subscription_df.select('SubscriptionId', 'OperationalWBS', 'Application')
    subscription_df = subscription_df.withColumnRenamed('SubscriptionId', 'SubId')
    subscription_df = subscription_df.withColumnRenamed('OperationalWBS', 'SubscriptionWBS')
    subscription_df = subscription_df.withColumnRenamed('Application', 'SubscriptionServiceNow-App')
    return subscription_df

def load_and_process_applications(application_path):
    application_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(application_path)
    application_df = application_df.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast("int"))
    return application_df

def write_output_file(cost_df, destinationFilename):

    cost_df = cost_df.drop('id', 'AdditionalInfo') 
    print('start to write to container')
    cost_df.write.format('parquet').mode('overwrite').option('path', destinationFilename).save()
    print('File write complete!')
